name: Prairie Falcon
overview: During their hunt the Prairie Falcon often uses a surprise attack on its prey by flying fast and low over the ground.  Adult Prairie Falcon are extremely territorial during the mating season and will fight off intruding with frequent stoops, loud sounds, and tail chases.
habitat: Prairie Falcons are typically found in open hills, plains, prairies, grasslands and deserts. Also they can be found in fairly dry open country above the tree line, high in the mountains. In the winter, they can be found living in cultivated fields, lakeshores, and desert scrub. They avoid forested country and are rare on the immediate coast.
